JUDGES: Aleš Pejchal;André Potocki;Ann Power-Forde;Ganna Yudkivska;Helena Jäderblom;Mark Villiger;Paul Lemmens
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE . Before being imprisoned the applicant lived in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr N. Kulchytskyy .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and CARDINAL accomplices attacked and robbed Mr PERSON , PERSON and PERSON . in their home .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested by police officers after being identified by PERSON

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) found the applicant guilty of robbery and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment , with confiscation of his property . The applicant was represented by CARDINAL lawyers in those proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG ( “ the Court of Appeal ” ) and ORG , respectively , upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , in the course of civil proceedings , ordered the applicant to pay CARDINAL NORP hryvnias ( ORG ) in respect of pecuniary damage and UAH CARDINAL,CARDINAL in respect of non - pecuniary damage in favour of PERSON and PERSON in compensation for the crime he had committed against them .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that judgment . The appeal was handwritten .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG remitted the appeal to ORG for a decision on whether it had been prepared in accordance with the procedural requirements .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that the applicant ’s appeal had not been properly submitted . The court noted , in particular , that the appeal had not been typewritten ; it did not contain the necessary information about the other parties to the proceedings ; it was not sufficiently reasoned ; no copies thereof had been enclosed for the other parties ; and the court fee for lodging an appeal had not been paid . The court therefore invited the applicant to rectify those shortcomings by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that the applicant had not rectified the shortcomings in his appeal and returned it to him unexamined .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted a new appeal against the judgment of DATE . The appeal was again handwritten . No evidence was enclosed suggesting that the applicant had paid a court fee , and the applicant did not request exemption from payment of the court fee .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG returned the appeal to ORG and suggested that it consider whether any steps should be taken to provide the applicant with the requisite facilities to prepare his appeal in accordance with the procedural formalities .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant signed an agreement with lawyer PERSON according to which that lawyer was to assist him in his criminal case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG extended the time - limit for appealing against the judgment of DATE and accepted the applicant ’s appeal . That hearing was attended by lawyer PERSON
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the case was sent to ORG .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG found that the applicant ’s appeal was again not typewritten . It therefore refused to open appeal proceedings and returned the case file to ORG .

CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW of DATE ( effective until DATE , the date when the Code of Civil Procedure of CARDINAL DATE came into force ) can be found in the judgment of PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
